data.text:
A new UN book takes kids on an adventure around the world, while teaching them how they can help achieve the #GlobalGoals.

Join Frieda on her journey to make a difference: https://t.co/QkOwKPMfNK https://t.co/e7d02F0y65
In Indonesia: @ILO helped improve facilities for new mothers in garment factories - benefitting workers, their babies & business. https://t.co/ZCAnMuAKXU
Foreign Direct Investment in Latin America & the Caribbean increased by 13.2% in 2018, ending a 5-year downward trend. Details in new @eclac_un report: https://t.co/VYGWhD9isJ https://t.co/hZDmZ492iw

Libya: Humanitarian truce leads to reduction of violence during #EidAlAdha, says @UNSMILibya, stressing need for permanent ceasefire & return to political process to end conflict. https://t.co/ugAJyTzEdz

Ebola: Number of children orphaned or left unaccompanied due to Ebola rising fast in Democratic Republic of the Congo. @UNICEF working closely with partners & communities to help vulnerable children. https://t.co/NJXGzSNaeW

➡️ 11.7M people in need of humanitarian assistance
➡️ 5.9M people internally displaced
➡️ 5.6M refugees 

As the war in Syria drags into its 9th year, @UNOCHA has more on the numbers behind this devastating conflict. https://t.co/djO4ZRkVEM

Around the world, brave #WomenHumanitarians are helping to make life better for some of the most vulnerable people. More from @UNOCHA ahead of next week's World Humanitarian Day. https://t.co/0kFVmEj6bV https://t.co/1qXxyBTfXR

Rivers are a source of life, but also death in northwestern Bangladesh, where torrential floods swept away homes and displaced more than 7 million people last month.

@WFP has more on how quick-thinking families faced down the monsoons. ⬇️ https://t.co/kf5myWlyp6

Ebola: 2 of the 4 drugs being tested in the Democratic Republic of the Congo have demonstrated greater effectiveness in saving lives and will be used to treat future patients. Latest from @WHO: https://t.co/IBmXP9KmMn https://t.co/IQZi1BHirr

Measles outbreaks continue to spread around the world, warns @WHO. Lack of access to quality healthcare & misinformation about vaccines contributing to spread of disease. https://t.co/KIGXbQC79m #VaccinesWork https://t.co/On263opyG6
.@Refugees calls on European governments to allow 500+ people recently rescued from Mediterranean & currently stranded at sea to immediately disembark to safety. https://t.co/qYgKmxMFaY

Access to voluntary family planning is particularly important for women in crisis settings. @UNFPA provides sexual & reproductive health support for displaced women in Ethiopia. https://t.co/qXA4CSLToy
Mali: Violent attacks leave 150 children dead in first half of 2019. Recruitment of children into armed groups doubled compared to last year, says @unicef. https://t.co/Uj1tcefBR8 #NotATarget

The climate crisis affects everyone - but it's the world's most vulnerable who bear the brunt. @UN_Women explains in this photo essay. #ClimateAction
https://t.co/voT2d19epT
Dreams of gold: @ILO's first-ever virtual reality project takes you into the unforgiving world of an African gold mine. https://t.co/IJKz5aJF6q

Every 2 weeks, the world loses an indigenous language and with it an entire cultural & intellectual heritage.

#IndigenousLanguages matter - and must be protected. https://t.co/tgIN5bYgGM #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/9LeM0fvRlr
Climate-smart agriculture can help protect our food supply. Find out how @FAO helps food producers adapt to the changing climate: https://t.co/BALZaKTd1W #ClimateAction https://t.co/0yn6YlYTSb

"The Holocaust did not start with the gas chambers - it started long before with hate speech." 
-- @UN_GP_RtoP's Adama Dieng on the dangers of hate speech. #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/UYsm8ZzNiH

#WomenHumanitarians around the world are doing incredible work to help people affected by crises. Ahead of #WHD2019, we honour all they do to make the world a better place. https://t.co/0kFVmE1vkn  via @UNOCHA https://t.co/69c5TpVWyd

☑️Taking #ClimateAction
☑️Reducing inequalities
☑️Ensuring inclusivity

Youth engagement is essential to the #GlobalGoals. More on Monday's #YouthDay: https://t.co/kskNcnIuDO https://t.co/6N98D2JcK6

Young people around the world have inspired me with their dynamism and determination.

At the UN we want to support young people in realizing their rights, including their right to education.

--@antonioguterres on Monday's #YouthDay. https://t.co/YXMhUlyifk https://t.co/NDca852lp5
Continues this week at @UNGeneva: Conference on Disarmament, 3rd part (through 13 September): https://t.co/wxkB1OMAbb https://t.co/UW5v2dK8Lv
Continues this week at @UNGeneva: Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination, 99th session (through 29 August): https://t.co/6knOwiF1nn #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/2oSBTOt0sb

Around the world, millions of young women & girls remain out of school.

On Monday's #YouthDay & every day, support equal access to quality education for everyone. https://t.co/kskNco05vm https://t.co/hr6GVf1Qol
Happening this week: #YouthDay & more. Full list here: https://t.co/aOqF6cdxHx https://t.co/fSFvlYI7Tq
The first 1000 days of a child's life are critical for their future. @WFP helps provide the early nutrition that can make the difference: https://t.co/v7zuaWzq0s

Monday's #YouthDay focuses on #TransformingEducation, highlighting efforts to make education

🤗 inclusive
↔️ equitable
👨‍🏫 relevant

More: https://t.co/Nc12UsF5FL https://t.co/qtDJLv1S9b

Zero-waste fashion helps reduce the strain on the environment & your wallet. Get tips for sustainable clothing from @Marissa_Rachel and Shanna Lisa - and track your #ClimateAction progress here: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n #ActNow https://t.co/iVU9rjI6bu

“I lost my self-esteem, dignity and respect."

48 countries and territories still maintain some form of HIV-related travel restriction. Here are the shocking stories of 6 people whose lives have been impacted: https://t.co/xPXiCzyLot via @UNAIDS https://t.co/DI2CtxX5mO

We look to world leaders, as they prepare for @antonioguterres' #ClimateAction Summit in September, to help all nations & people reboot their relationships with nature.

-- @davidnabarro & Susan Gardner in @ClimateHome https://t.co/pRDVH3NWi0

📸: These women in Democratic Republic of Congo do outreach to inform communities about Ebola, reducing fear & encouraging people to seek early treatment. https://t.co/DPhVVhvlex https://t.co/TGKzvxbgGs

Marc Chagall's memorial to former Secretary-General Dag Hammarskjöld is among the many iconic works of art on display at UN Headquarters in NYC. See more of them here: https://t.co/KfQZigA4eP https://t.co/6fwaPSqmo8
"#ClimateAction for Peace" is the theme of next month's #PeaceDay, focusing on protecting our planet as a way to promote peace around the 🌎 https://t.co/eSz3GOQn9a https://t.co/vvsez6yIiJ

Indigenous peoples

➡️Account for 15% of the world's poorest
➡️Lead on protecting the environment
➡️Fight the climate crisis every day

More indigenous facts via @UNDP: https://t.co/wB9kdzBw0r #WeAreIndigenous

10,000 litres of water are needed to make a single pair of jeans.

By shopping 2nd-hand, buying eco-friendly clothes & donating what you no longer use, you can reduce the environmental impact of your 👖& protect our 🌎. https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n #ActNow https://t.co/S6Vt95woqb

Eid Mubarak!

Wishing all those who are celebrating a happy and peaceful #EidAlAdha. https://t.co/DeMoWmuNQc
Around 8000 women are #ServingForPeace in 14 @UNPeacekeeping missions around the world. Find out why recruiting & retaining women is critical for mission success. https://t.co/VF26jIhRLl

Agriculture, forestry & other types of land use account for 23% of human greenhouse gas emissions, says new @IPCC_CH report. But land can also be part of the solution to the climate crisis. https://t.co/luTsmfbcN0 #ClimateAction https://t.co/7RHAuwrAYT

🍎 Learn to grow fruits & vegetables
👫Develop team work skills
🥕Promote better nutrition

... just a few of the benefits of school gardens. Find out more from @FAO: https://t.co/4QuzzH0hmc #ZeroHunger https://t.co/JFNZZLCCnt

Does the UN have an official anthem or hymn?
Where can you find UN treaties and conventions?
How is the contribution of a country to the UN budget determined?

Got a question about the UN? - #AskDag can answer: https://t.co/WyiL9ZfcGy https://t.co/l1HLErJXMD
New @UNFCCC report highlights urgent need for scaling up #ClimateAction;  UN Summit in September a major opportunity: https://t.co/JCtyIVjVzW https://t.co/W66LEsNZAj

YOU have the power to respond to the climate crisis.

Small changes in habits - like cycling instead of driving - can make a big difference. Join @ElyxYak and #ActNow: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/USK9p2aTlo
More than 7 million people in South Sudan are receiving life-saving support from @WFP, including through food drops such as this one ⬇️ #ZeroHunger https://t.co/2bCMrXxr3i

📷: The "Good Defeats Evil" Sculpture at UNHQ depicts St. George slaying dragon, created from fragments of nuclear missiles.

This week marks 74 years since the nuclear bombings of Hiroshima & Nagasaki. https://t.co/EnzOh5Owsc https://t.co/KSunGP94C8

"With every language that disappears, the world loses a wealth of traditional knowledge." -- @antonioguterres on Friday's #IndigenousDay. https://t.co/mfhHTIs1DW #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/0EGswi9jQF

Indigenous peoples are the guardians of 80% of global biodiversity.

On Friday's #IndigenousDay, @FAO shares how indigenous food systems help achieve the #GlobalGoals: https://t.co/S5EEfdS9ZC https://t.co/cPck9qP0e7

UN independent rights experts welcome royal decrees allowing Saudi women to apply for passports and women aged 21+ to travel independently without their guardians’ permission, but call for further steps. https://t.co/lcSUXiMwnf
Indigenous peoples = 5% of 🌎's population & 60% of 🌎's languages. Find out more on Friday's #IndigenousDay: https://t.co/dbvAthoYiS #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/tYPctINjxd
Syria: New wave of violence threatening lives of millions of civilians who live in Idlib area; more than a million of them are children. https://t.co/EKNsNQcTPV

Friday is #IndigenousDay.

Use #WeAreIndigenous to celebrate the world's 370 million indigenous peoples who represent 5000 cultures. https://t.co/Igng7DGoz0 https://t.co/yjKlx1xmvN

.@antonioguterres is following the situation in Jammu & Kashmir with concern and appeals for maximum restraint. He calls on all parties to refrain from taking steps that could affect the status of Jammu and Kashmir: https://t.co/sltkTGTjBk
New @IPCC_CH report shows that 500 million people live in land degraded by climate change & misuse, which contributes to migration: https://t.co/luTsmfsNEy #ClimateAction https://t.co/0MgPaqWuuV

The climate crisis is increasing the intensity & frequency of extreme weather events, forcing people to flee their homes. Find out more about disaster displacement from @refugees: https://t.co/AGEtYcMsRq

https://t.co/qHJhMb0247

More than 2 million people in Zimbabwe are facing starvation after severe drought.

Here's how you can help @WFP provide life-saving food aid: https://t.co/UksMycJtlM #ZeroHunger https://t.co/u8ClYnRAeI

Ways to live a sustainable lifestyle & become be part of the zero-waste fashion movement:
🔸 Buy eco-friendly clothes
🔸 Shop second-hand
🔸 Keep track of your #ClimateAction progress: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV #ActNow https://t.co/fL3Raaqfqt
Afghanistan: @UNAMAnews outraged by Wednesday's attack in Kabul that caused civilian casualties. https://t.co/TNTzEQxCjj

Oceans
🌊 feed us
🌊 regulate our climate
🌊 generate most of our oxygen
🌊 serve as foundation for much of the world’s economy 

More about the importance of #CleanSeas from @UNEnvironment: https://t.co/a81m6iLusA 

 https://t.co/2kVaunrjoI

"Accountability for serious violations of international humanitarian law & human rights is central to achieving & maintaining durable peace in Syria." --
@UNDPPA chief Rosemary DiCarlo tells Security Council. https://t.co/RhVMspP8cG https://t.co/DtUqX3yF8O

Happy birthday, to our Messenger of Peace @CharlizeAfrica! Thank you for your tireless commitment to HIV prevention and the elimination of violence against women. https://t.co/TQouWByvL2 #GlobalGoals https://t.co/86zdsJcF78

In 19 countries, women are required by law to obey their husbands.

In 31 countries, married women can’t chose where to live.

We must eliminate discriminatory laws for #FamiliesOfToday https://t.co/vVzffsntUf via @UN_Women

https://t.co/lxwatpyFsk
Wednesday marks the last day of World Breastfeeding Week. @UNICEF shares 14 myths about breastfeeding: https://t.co/m46qyT1JVO #ForEveryChild
The largest number of refugees on the African continent are from South Sudan. 63% of them are children. Find out how @Refugees is supporting them. #WithRefugees https://t.co/npnQDjn09v
NEWS: Colombian Government announces new measure to ensure children born in the country to Venezuelan parents are able to acquire Colombian nationality. https://t.co/0zUHTUupcq via @refugees

Racism
Xenophobia
Intolerance

exist in all societies.

But every day, each and every one of us can stand up against racial prejudice and intolerant attitudes. https://t.co/SWzARZPfow https://t.co/FFOBJeJlnL

"As we mark this 74th anniversary of the first use of a nuclear weapon in war, nearly 14,000 nuclear warheads exist, many still on hair-trigger alert. Much work remains to be done to lessen & ultimately remove this peril." -- @antonioguterres https://t.co/GHpslC4DI7 https://t.co/OtHU2TvVpx

Myanmar: Business revenues enhance military's ability to carry out gross human rights violations, according to UN Independent Fact-Finding Mission, which calls on international community to impose sanctions & arms embargoes on the country's military.
https://t.co/oIGu7UZySm

"Literature has the power to transform us in ways that politics never can.  And few writers have demonstrated that power more magically than Toni Morrison."

-Former Secretary-General @KofiAnnan with fellow Nobel Laureate Toni Morrison at UNHQ in 2002. https://t.co/oqU3sTYHB1 https://t.co/APLywGkXz2

Ebola: @WHO continues its vaccination campaigns in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, while @UNICEF & partners care for children separated from their parents or orphaned by the illness. https://t.co/8ZXAAcTxJ2 https://t.co/X4Dt8KPAOK
Millions of women and girls live in the long shadows of human trafficking across the world. Here are the stories of three survivors via @UN_Women https://t.co/V7nPi7Eo4l #EndHumanTrafficking

2019 Hunger Map: around 821 million people do not get enough to eat - that's more than 1 in 9 of the world population.

Here's how @WFP helps: https://t.co/nMjW6lBXHf #ZeroHunger https://t.co/uQHjLuhd4b
#TourTuesday: The "Knotted Gun" sculpture outside UNHQ in NYC is an inspirational symbol of non-violence. More on the iconic sculpture: https://t.co/N2zU9uFjF3 https://t.co/6kTmO3JdZe

"Lasting peace & stability in Libya, including an end to the worsening humanitarian crisis, will come only through a political solution." -- Security Council reaffirms call for ceasefire. https://t.co/2v0RJizilq https://t.co/YH5nBe1y5p

.@antonioguterres has condemned & expressed outrage over the mass shootings in Ohio & Texas.

He extends heartfelt condolences to victims' families & loved ones and stresses need to work together to counter violence rooted in hatred, racism & xenophobia. https://t.co/8RH9Sx1I3Q https://t.co/FRfcaQL8z0

One way to take #ClimateAction: 

Instead of getting behind the wheel of a car 🚗

Hop on your bike 🚲 or 

Walk 🚶🏾‍♀️ 

#BreatheLife https://t.co/9E8EFtvOvT

Zero-waste fashion helps reduce the strain on the environment & your wallet. Instead of buying new clothes, #ActNow to give your old favorites a second chance: https://t.co/X0ShwftNUV #ClimateActoin https://t.co/3pJIhMawX2

"We will never give up our efforts to secure peace, reduce human suffering and build a sustainable world for people and planet" -- @antonioguterres last week.

More on the work of the UN here: https://t.co/PY3Cb6rJmj https://t.co/N6u5GyC6i6

The International Law Commission continues its 71st session at 
@UNGeneva this week. Details: https://t.co/5hH8LJzlBq https://t.co/qPqwODfy0d
Continues this week at @UNGeneva: Conference on Disarmament, 3rd part (through 13 September): https://t.co/wxkB1OMAbb https://t.co/3EL0lpP5oJ
Happening this week: #IndigenousDay, @IPCC_CH session & much more. Full list here: https://t.co/aOqF6cv967 https://t.co/yFPCwh7jIq
Starts Monday @UNGeneva: Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination, 99th session (through 29 August): https://t.co/6knOwiWCeV #StandUp4HumanRights https://t.co/CavO8bRXHk

At least 26 countries have laws requiring parental or guardian consent for adolescents to access contraceptives. 

More from @UNAIDS on laws and policies around the world related to the AIDS response: https://t.co/nr4YaxeYwj https://t.co/wgr1lUrUdN

The annual @WMO 📸 competition is open for entries until 15 August. This year's theme is "Climate and Water" and winning entries will appear in the 2020 WMO calendar. Details: https://t.co/w4Bf0KQZS2 https://t.co/NNwJFZ2YLs

📸: "One Day, I Will" photo exhibit from @UNOCHA captures the hopes, dreams & power of girls caught in humanitarian crises. Have a look at their portraits & find out more about their stories: https://t.co/qKIwiQL8vO https://t.co/YbeujeTPjK
#ClimateAction, violent extremism & equality were the focus of @antonioguterres' recent trip to Kenya & Mozambique. Find out what he heard from local communities.  https://t.co/UxtJeGXRRT

📷: Ebola survivors celebrate with their community in Democratic Republic of Congo.

There has been much progress in the year since start of latest Ebola outbreak in the country - but more needs to be done to combat the disease. https://t.co/RPxfW9oLAI https://t.co/bXMkAQ3Z1U

☑️Increased productivity
☑️Improved satisfaction
☑️Reduced absenteeism

Family-friendly policies benefit not only families & babies but also businesses. https://t.co/5htj8Pihzj https://t.co/L5dRau4rmr

Want to get inspired by the #ClimateAction already underway across the world? Check out these award-winning projects helping to protect our planet from @Momentum_UNFCCC: https://t.co/Z9Xxrhgo4U https://t.co/NvNIqgeX4r

Every year, around one million people seek asylum.

Here's how @refugees works to protect their human rights and dignity: https://t.co/IMDF0J0mLC #WithRefugees https://t.co/SqMceetxES

YOU have the power to respond to the climate crisis.

Small changes in habits - like recycling , refusing single-use plastics & eating less meat - can make a big difference. Join @ElyxYak and #ActNow: https://t.co/X0Shwfcd3n https://t.co/USveP2XW4B

"Together, we can put out the wildfire of hate and uphold the values that bind us together as a single human family" -- @antonioguterres.

Get details on the UN plan of action on hate speech here: https://t.co/CIruflBozI https://t.co/c2cenp227b
The @UNAOC #YouthSolidarityFund supports youth-led organizations who contribute to peaceful and inclusive societies. Learn more & apply: https://t.co/s7zptn0sJK https://t.co/kFUFDHFcpJ

Climate change is a race we can and must win. It’s easy to take #ClimateAction:
🍎 Buy local or organic food
🔌 Unplug unused appliances
🚿 Use less hot water
💡 More ideas here: https://t.co/ZA3k0bd75T #ActNow https://t.co/h0d2H5WOaa

Almost 50% of children regularly breathe air polluted by tobacco smoke in public places.

Support #NoTobacco 🚭 measures because everyone deserves tobacco-smoke-free air. https://t.co/OgBSLuvgwG https://t.co/tzSK2dsHsu

It is vitally important that we come together & focus on the current plight of children affected by armed conflict across the 4 corners of the globe. -- UN Special Representative for @childreninwar tells Security Council. https://t.co/Q35AV8oSE2 https://t.co/rlV7poP529

.@antonioguterres deeply regrets the ending of the Intermediate-Range Nuclear Forces Treaty, which has contributed to the maintenance of international peace and stability since 1988. https://t.co/NywDZRee8a https://t.co/aSqbKs9vWn

Only halfway through the monsoon season, 2.3 million people in Bangladesh have been affected. @WFP is racing against the clock to help those impacted most by the climate crisis. https://t.co/fdQkII4Cwy

https://t.co/3n6QyV4cEQ

Starting Friday, @IPCC_CH meeting looks at how the way we use our land contributes to climate change - and how climate change affects our land. https://t.co/aIzZedHyvR #ClimateAction https://t.co/IyKv4SzrpF

"We are on track for the period from 2015 to 2019 to be the five hottest years on record" -- @antonioguterres on why he is convening a #ClimateAction Summit in September https://t.co/Vn6VtSvUZO

 https://t.co/jFr8BJha8e
